data.question: What is the DOI of the article discussing the synthesis of a redox-active two-dimensional coordination polymer and its application in nanoparticle formation?
Which coordination polymer is reported to produce Ag and Au nanoparticles upon immersion in respective metal ion solutions?
What transformation occurs to compound 1 upon heating at 180°C under 10^-5 Torr for 24 hours?
data.answer: Compound 1 undergoes a single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation to form a dehydrated solid {[Ni(cyclam)]2[BPTC]}n (2).

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of Ag nanoparticles using the coordination polymer {[Ni(cyclam)]2[BPTC]}n·2nH2O requires an extra reducing agent.
What is the role of Ni(II) ions in the formation of Ag and Au nanoparticles as described in the article?
data.answer: Ni(II) ions are oxidized to Ni(III) state during the redox reaction with Ag(I) and Au(III) ions, facilitating the formation of Ag(0) and Au(0) nanoparticles.

data.question: True or False: The size and shape of the nanoparticles formed are significantly affected by the concentration of metal ions, temperature, and type of solvent.
What experimental technique was used to determine the crystal structures of compounds 1 and 2?
True or False: The framework structure of the coordination polymer is maintained even after the formation of metal nanoparticles.
What is the effect of guest water molecule removal on the coordination polymer {[Ni(cyclam)]2[BPTC]}n·2nH2O?
data.answer: Removal of guest water molecules leads to extensive dynamic motions of the molecular components, involving rotation, swing, and bending, which reduces the interlayer distance.

data.question: True or False: The formation of Ag and Au nanoparticles using the coordination polymer involves a stoichiometric redox reaction between the metal ions and Ni(II) species.
